newsitem.title: FRANCE: France Telecom plans $3 bln Euro MTN programme.
newsitem.headline: France Telecom plans $3 bln Euro MTN programme.

text.p: France Telecom said on Thursday that it planned to establish a $3 billion Euro medium term note programme due to be signed in early June.
"France Telecom will be the sole issuer under the programme," it said in a statement.
The programme is being arranged by Merrill Lynch International, with Paribas acting as French franc arranger.
Merrill Lynch International, Paribas, ABN Amro, Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, Nomura, SBC Warburg and UBS will be dealers on the programme.
Citibank has been appointed financial and paying agent.
